nodes.bodyText: alias maybe null, please change the logic here.

I recommend that you straightly make results a Map<Integer, Exception> and record the potential QueryProcessException into it since createTimeSeries always returns true if there is no exception. And when changed this way, you would be able to tell the user what are the reasons behind the failures, instead of a simple failure.
It's not recommended to use star syntax in import
Maybe we need a switch to allow partial success if error log was output in debug level

commit.message: return error message to client when create time series

beforeCommit.message: return error message to client when create time series

afterCommit.message: return error message to client when create time series

nodes.bodyText:
I think the messages of the exceptions should be put into the statuses.
RpcUtils.getStatus(TSStatusCode.EXECUTE_STATEMENT_ERROR, entry.getValue().getMessage())
